list_definition.definition: (of a person) who becomes angry very easily

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s a bad-tempered old man who doesn’t have a good word for anyone.

list_ex_of_english: It has also been somewhat tetchy and bad-tempered in places.
It was not a rottweiler, a doberman or an alsatian but a bad-tempered old cross-breed which probably had some terrier and some labrador in it.
He may be even a bad-tempered bully who has been prosecuted for cruelty to animals.
Imagine trying to put that to a court of law about a bad-tempered man.
That is why my noble friend is depressed and bad-tempered.
The debate so far has been a futile, noisy, bad-tempered charade.
He will not reveal the truth to her, but is abrupt and bad-tempered.
Yes, we have had some very bad-tempered speeches, and it is no good running away from the fact.
